org.ftccommunity.org.ftccommunity.ftcxtensible.robot

Class ExtensibleLinearOpMode

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.OpMode
      • org.ftccommunity.org.ftccommunity.ftcxtensible.robot.ExtensibleOpMode
        • org.ftccommunity.org.ftccommunity.ftcxtensible.robot.ExtensibleLinearOpMode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AbstractRobotContext, FullOpMode, OpModeLoop 

    public abstract class ExtensibleLinearOpMode
extends ExtensibleOpMode
    An extensible version of a linear OpMode, designed for higher levels of synchronisation as well as better access to the underlying loop. This locks/unlocks a Watchdog object to a allow synchronisation, if need be. This notifies all threads waiting on this object when a new loop cycle is being executed. An ExtensibleLinearOpMode.EventWatcher can be registered on this to allow for the receiving of Event notifications.
    Since:
    0.3.1
    Author:
    David Sargent
    See Also:
    LinearAutoModeAdapter

      • runOpMode

        protected abstract void runOpMode()
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        The entry-point for user code execution. All code inside here gets executed by a high- priority thread named "OpMode Runner." Call on the watchdog() to sync up with the looping structures within the OpMode.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • waitUntil

        protected final void waitUntil(@NotNull
                               ExtensibleLinearOpMode.OpModeState waitTillState)
                        throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                               java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Blocks until a given OpMode state is achevied
        Parameters:
        waitTillState - the state to block until the OpMode achieves
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - the current thread gets interrupted while waiting on the state change
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the state has already been achieved in the OpMode

      • waitForStart

        protected final void waitForStart()
                           throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                  java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Waits for the OpMode state to achieve a the OpModeState.START state
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - the thread is interrupted while waiting for the state change
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - the START changeover has already been achieved

      • sleep

        protected void sleep(long milliseconds)
              throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Sleeps the calling thread for the given number of milliseconds
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - the number of milliseconds to sleep
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - the calling thread was interrupted while sleeping

      • sleep

        protected void sleep(long duration,
                     java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
              throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Sleeps the calling thread for the given duration. The duration is then recalculated into milliseconds in a process that truncates the given duration, for example if this was called with for the duration and NANOSECONDS for the unit, the current thread would sleep for 0 milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        duration - the number of units to sleep for
        unit - what unit the duration is in
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - the calling thread was interrupted while sleeping

      • waitForLoops

        protected void waitForLoops(int loops)
                     throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                            java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Blocks until the given number of loop cycles has happened
        Parameters:
        loops - the number of loops to block for
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - the calling thread has been interrupted
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the loops parameter is negative or equal to zero

      • waitOneLoop

        protected void waitOneLoop()
                    throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits for one loop cycle to happen. This returns at the very next loop after the original calling one loop has returned back to the SDK. If you need more please use waitForLoops(int)
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - the calling thread was interrupted while sleeping

      • queue

        @NotNull
public com.google.common.collect.EvictingQueue<java.lang.Object> queue()
